titlestmt.titleproper: Catalog of the Walt Whitman Literary Manuscripts in the Walt Whitman Ephemera Collection, University of Tulsa

Minks and revised by Andrew Jewell, The Walt Whitman Archive, and Mary Ellen Ducey, University of Nebraska-Lincoln Libraries, 2003. Revised by Brett Barney, The Walt Whitman Archive, 2006. Expanded by Janel Cayer, The Walt Whitman Archive, 2014.

did.unittitle: Walt Whitman Literary Manuscripts in the Walt Whitman Ephemera Collection, University of Tulsa

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p:
To identify this catalog as a source, see the Archive's
"Conditions of Use" page.

scopecontent.p: A partial draft of a prose piece, with the cancelled title Convalescence. A revised version of this draft fragment was first published in Specimen Days & Collect (1882–1883) as The Oaks and I. Whitman included The Oaks and I unchanged in Complete Prose (1892).

Whitman's notes for a poem about "a perfect school." No connection between these notes and any of his published works has been established. The lines on the verso, tul.00002, contributed to Whitman's 1855 poem To Think of Time.

unittitle.title: [The three or four poets are well]

scopecontent.p: Ten lines, heavily revised, that contributed to Whitman's poem To Think of Time, first published without a title in the 1855 edition of Leaves of Grass, as Burial Poem in 1856, Burial in 1860 and 1867, and under its final title in 1871. On the verso is tul.00011, notes toward a poem that is not known to have been published.
